intro: Lycopsis variegata var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered lycopsis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its variegated foliage, featuring a mix of green and white or cream-colored patterns on its leaves. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in dense inflorescences, adding a subtle ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
